event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when LACP port changes its state.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if optical monitoring is enabled but optics vendor is not Foundry Networks.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if optical monitoring is enabled but the Foundry optic is not capable.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if a new entry is added to static multicast mac configuration table. Format 1: Static Mac entry with Mac Address is added to portnumber on VLAN Format 2: Static Mac entry with Mac Address is added to portmask <0xXXXXXXXX-XXXXXXXX> on VLAN

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if an entry is removed from static multicast mac configuration table . Format 1: Static Mac entry with Mac Address is deleted from portnumber on VLAN Format 2: Static Mac entry with Mac Address is deleted from portmask <0xXXXXXXXX-XXXXXXXX> on VLAN

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP notification that is generated when a port is re-enabled after being disabled due to BPDU Guard Violation. Format: STP: BPDU Guard re-enabled on VLAN port /

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

snVLanByPortCfgVLanId %parm[#2]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapSTPBPDUGuardExpire trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% snVLanByPortCfgVLanId=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP notification is generated when a port loop is detected. Format: LOOP DETECTION: VLAN , port / detect, putting into err-disable state

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

snVLanByPortCfgVLanId %parm[#2]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapPortLoopDetection trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% snVLanByPortCfgVLanId=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when system is running out of TCAM spaces allocated for routing entries.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a unit is elected as Master unit for the stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a unit has been added to the stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a unit has been deleted from the stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a power supply operational status changed from failure to normal for a stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasPwrSupplyIndex %parm[#2]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapStackingChasPwrSupplyOK trap received snChasUnitIndex=%parm[#1]% snChasPwrSupplyIndex=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when a power supply operational status changed from normal to failure for a stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasPwrSupplyIndex %parm[#2]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapStackingChasPwrSupplyFailed trap received snChasUnitIndex=%parm[#1]% snChasPwrSupplyIndex=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when a fan operational status changed from failure to normal for a stacking system

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasFanIndex %parm[#2]%;

snChasFanDescription %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapStackingChasFanNormal trap received snChasUnitIndex=%parm[#1]% snChasFanIndex=%parm[#2]% snChasFanDescription=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when a fan fails to operate normally for a stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasFanIndex %parm[#2]%;

snChasFanDescription %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapStackingChasFanFailed trap received snChasUnitIndex=%parm[#1]% snChasFanIndex=%parm[#2]% snChasFanDescription=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when the managemnet MAC address of a stacking system has been changed.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the actual temperature reading is above the warning temperature threshold for a stack sytem.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the Interface Index (IfIndex) assignment for the physical interfaces was changed.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a Policy Based Routing (PBR) routemap is bound or unbound either globally or to an interface.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when an External Redundant Power Supply (RPS2-EIF) is added to the system.

snChasPwrSupplyIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasPwrSupplyDescription %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when an External Redundant Power Supply (RPS2-EIF) is removed from the system.

snChasPwrSupplyIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasPwrSupplyDescription %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP notification that is generated when a module's operational state changes. The management entity receiving the notification can identify the module and the event by referencing snChasUnitIndex, snAgentBrdIndex, snAgentBrdModuleStatus. In case of a module-down event, the varbind snAgGblTrapMessage is a text string that describes the cause. In case of module-up event, snAgGblTrapMessage is a null string.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgentBrdIndex %parm[#2]%;

snAgentBrdModuleStatus %parm[#3]%;

moduleEmpty(0) moduleGoingDown(2) moduleRejected(3) moduleBad(4) moduleConfigured(8) moduleComingUp(9) moduleRunning(10) moduleBlocked(11)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapModuleStatusChange trap received snChasUnitIndex=%parm[#1]% snAgentBrdIndex=%parm[#2]% snAgentBrdModuleStatus=%parm[#3]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when chassis doesn't have high speed fans for specific modules

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the revertible sysmax elements are reverted during the card bringup if they can not be accommodated in the available memory.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when its found during bootup that the configured sysmax set shall leave less than 10% available memory free.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the available dynamic memory in a card is below 5% of the installed physical memory.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the dynamic memory fails to be allocated in a system.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when Link-OAM port link status has changed to down.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when Link-OAM port link status has changed to up.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated to provide information about state of the management module's I2C accesses.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when Link-OAM port has entered loopback mode. The link is not useful for data transfer any more.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

dot3OamLoopbackStatus %parm[#2]%;

noLoopback(1) initiatingLoopback(2) remoteLoopback(3) terminatingLoopback(4) localLoopback(5) unknown(6)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapLinkOAMLoopbackEntered trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% dot3OamLoopbackStatus=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when Link-OAM port has entered loopback mode. The link is not useful for data transfer any more.

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

dot3OamLoopbackStatus %parm[#2]%;

noLoopback(1) initiatingLoopback(2) remoteLoopback(3) terminatingLoopback(4) localLoopback(5) unknown(6)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapLinkOAMLoopbackCleared trap received ifIndex=%parm[#1]% dot3OamLoopbackStatus=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when a new license is added to the system.

fdryLicenseType %parm[#1]%;

normal(1) trial(2)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when an existing license is removed from the system.

fdryLicenseType %parm[#1]%;

normal(1) trial(2)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a trial license is about to expire. This trap is generated daily for last 3 days and every 2 hours on the last day of expire.

fdryLicenseType %parm[#1]%;

normal(1) trial(2)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a trial license has expired.

fdryLicenseType %parm[#1]%;

normal(1) trial(2)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when UDLD detects CRC failures on PDUs received on a port

ifIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

rMepIdle(1) rMepStart(2) rMepFailed(3) rMepOk(4)

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when a unit is elected as Standby unit for the stacking system.

snChasUnitIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP notification is generated when MAC movement exceeding the certain threshold for a sampling interval is detected. Format: Mac-Move threshold-rate: MAC address moved from interface to interface for vlan , times exceeding the threshold rate for a sampling interval seconds

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP notification is generated every user configured interval, summarizing the moves in the interval . Format: Mac-Move Interval-History: <#macs> macs moved in last seconds. Total number of mac moves in the interval is <#moves>

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a fan operational status changed from failure to normal or change in the fan speed due to temperature variations downwards.

snChasFanIndex %parm[#1]%;

snChasFanDescription %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the actual temperature reading is below the warning temperature threshold.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when any CAM partition becomes full.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if there is a warning during optical monitoring. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second optional varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if there is an alarm during optical monitoring. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second optional varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if there is an error during optical monitoring. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second optional varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if there is a warning during POS alarm monitoring. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second optional varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if there is an alarm up/down during POS alarm monitoring. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second optional varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if there is an error during POS alarm monitoring. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second optional varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if optics is incompatible with port configuration.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if TM logging is started by an event trigger.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if TM logging stopped due to storage full.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if TM logging restarted after user clearing the log.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated if optics vendor is not Foundry Networks.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when TM recovery slot reset is triggered.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when system detects egress data errors on Traffic Manager. For e.g. Fabric Monitoring : TM Egress data errors detected on LP /TM

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a link from LP Traffic Manager to SFM Fabric Element is down. For eg. Fabric Monitoring Link Down : SFM /FE /Link , LP /TM

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a link from LP Traffic Manager to SFM Fabric Element is up. For eg. Fabric Monitoring Link Up : SFM /FE /Link , LP /TM

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when system fails to access a SFM Fabric Element. For e.g. Fabric Monitoring : Device access failure in SFM /FE

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP notification that is generated when there is a change in the operational state of the Switch Fabric Module (SFM). For example, System: Health Monitoring: SFM powered off due to failure detection

snAgentBrdIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgentBrdModuleStatus %parm[#2]%;

moduleEmpty(0) moduleGoingDown(2) moduleRejected(3) moduleBad(4) moduleConfigured(8) moduleComingUp(9) moduleRunning(10) moduleBlocked(11)

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#3]%;
event.logmsg: snTrapSFMStatusChange trap received snAgentBrdIndex=%parm[#1]% snAgentBrdModuleStatus=%parm[#2]% snAgGblTrapMessage=%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
The SNMP notification that is generated when there is a change in the operational state of the Switch Fabric Module (SFM). For example, System: Health Monitoring: SFM powered off due to failure detection

event.descr:
The SNMP trap that is generated when all chassis fans change to low speed.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when all chassis fans change to medium speed.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when all chassis fans change to medium high speed.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when all chassis fans change to high speed.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when FIPS mode is enabled.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when FIPS mode is disabled.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when host keys are zeroized in FIPS mode

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when shared secret are zeroized in FIPS mode

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated after POST.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated on cryptographic module failure.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when a 2 port license cannot be applied due to hardware limitation.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when an interface transitions from an error to normal state because the alarms/warnings are below the threshold. snTrapOpticalMonitoringError would have been earlier generated when the interface transitioned to the error state. The first varbind, snAgGblTrapMessage, will have a detailed message on the cause of event. The second varbind, ifIndex, points to the affected interface originating this event. If an event does not have associated port, or has multiple associated ports, then ifIndex will have maximum value 0x7ffffff.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

ifIndex %parm[#2]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when system can successfully access an SFM Fabric Element. snTrapSFMAccessError would have been generated when the system failed to access the FE. For e.g. Fabric Monitoring : Device SFM /FE is OK to access.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the single-command package upgrade has started. This happens after a successful download and validation of manifest file and before the first image download takes place.

The SNMP trap that is generated when the single-command package upgrade completed, or partially completed. The table brcdSwPackageLoadResultTable lists the result of the upgrade.

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when an auto-upgrade on a line card has started.

snAgentBrdIndex %parm[#1]%;

The SNMP trap that is generated when the auto-upgrade of interface module completed.

snAgentBrdIndex %parm[#1]%;

snAgGblTrapMessage %parm[#2]%;
